metadata.Title: CVE-2022-35256 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The llhttp parser in the http module in Node v18.7.0 does not correctlyhandle header fields that are not terminated with CLRF. This may result inHTTP Request Smuggling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35256` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2').
